info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 15 at 7:28PM MDT until June 15 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico... Northwestern El Paso County in western Texas...
* Until 830 PM MDT.
* At 727 PM MDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of White Sands National Park to 4 miles southwest of Sunland Park, moving west at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Doppler radar.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 111 and 164. Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 26. Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 25. Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 150 and 178.
Locations impacted include... West El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Mission Valley, Chaparral, Leasburg, Santa Teresa, Vado, Las Cruces, Anthony, White Sands Missile Range Headquarters, Jornada Range, Radium Springs, Sunland Park, Dona Ana, Afton, Anthony Gap, NMSU Main Campus, Canutillo, and Berino.
info.instruction:
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; El Paso, TX
